title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: When compiling a class from a subpackage using the command "ajc subpackage\Test.java," the compiler creates a new "subpackage" directory under the existing "subpackage" directory instead of placing the compiled class file in the existing "subpackage" directory.
EB: The compiled class file should be placed in the existing "subpackage" directory without creating a new "subpackage" directory.
SR:
1. Create a class in a subpackage.
2. Compile the class using the command "ajc -d . subpackage\Test.java".
